channel.title: RNZ Media & Technology Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Media & Technology headlines from RNZ News

item.title: 'I wasted seven years of my life not being on that journey' Mike McRoberts' journey to reclaim his reo
item.description: The broadcaster has been open about his struggles to reclaim his ancestral language.

item.title: 'The AI chatbot helped her write a suicide note'
item.description: Sophie Rottenberg took her own life after interacting ChatGPT-based AI therapist named Harry. Warning: This story discusses suicide.

item.title: How can I put my phone down and stop doomscrolling?
item.description: It starts with one simple task on your phone. Next minute, you've been endlessly scrolling social media for an hour.

item.title: Is this TikTok star really Kiwi actor KJ Apa?
item.description: Fans have been digging for clues to find out if the Kiwi actor is behind an alter ego singer sporting a wig and funky outfits.

item.title: RNZ-ABC series on Rainbow Warrior sinking scoops major prize at Asia Podcast Awards
item.description: The series looks at the "collateral damage" to a Pacific people hit hard by nuclear testing.

item.title: Who is Anna Wintour's replacement at Vogue?
item.description: Vogue has announced that Chloe Malle will head up the fashion magazine's US edition, replacing world-renowned figure Anna Wintour.

item.title: Stuff staff walk off the job and picket outside newsrooms
item.description: They are protesting in response to what they say are low pay offers and attempts to divide the workforce.

item.title: Is there anything you can do about public shaming on internet?
item.description: Explainer : Naming and shaming, false rumours or a photo that upends your life - is there anything you can do about it?

item.title: Sky TV's net profit plummets by 58%
item.description: However, the pay TV operator is delivering on its guidance of paying a dividend of at least 21 cents per share.

item.title: NZ film, TV industry weighs pros and cons of Artificial Intelligence
item.description: Artificial Intelligence has made previously tedious tasks quick and easy, but also carries risks for local film-makers.

item.title: Stuff staff vote to strike over collective agreement
item.description: It is understood they are unhappy about the company's plans to split their collective agreement.

item.title: 'Cheap and realistic': How Alice Taylor became an Instagram cooking star
item.description: "So much of what's online is so perfect, it does feel like this really strong contrast… Showing normality is super important."

item.title: Mediawatch: RNZ rejigging radio to arrest audience decline
item.description: RNZ is targeting listeners in Auckland and New Zealanders over 50 after a review of programmes and news prompted by declines in RNZ National's live listenership.

item.title: The TikTok creators profiting from medical misinformation
item.description: "I don't understand how this could be out there."

item.title: The show giving rangatahi a bird's eye view of their kāinga
item.description: A new children's series is giving tamariki Māori the chance to take the pilot's seat, using drone technology to see their marae and tūrangawaewae from a different angle.

item.title: Ditching screen-time guilt could help families connect, psychologist says
item.description: Like many parents, Andrew* and Maggie* battled with their child over his creeping device time.

item.title: What is Instagram's Map feature? How do I turn it off?
item.description: The social media platform has launched a new tool for users to share their location with friends in real time.

item.title: Does this ad about baldness offend you?
item.description: "You look better bald... said no-one ever." That's the sentence on a digital billboard in Auckland that's dividing views with one critic calling it cruel and "body shaming".
